title: Individualized Instructional Design for Strengthening Motivation in Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical computation skills and comprehension of middle school-level math concepts
context.additional_context: Diagnosing individual learners' mathematical learning motivation types and designing customized lessons responsive to motivational changes. Applying personalized strategies reflecting individual learning purposes (employment, academic return, etc.).

learning_goals: Within four weeks, learners can explain three or more types of their motivational types (instrumental/intrinsic/social) in the mathematical problem-solving process.
Based on individualized learning plans, learners practice self-directed mathematical learning at least twice a week and reflect on formative assessments.
Through peer feedback, learners discover five or more practical values of mathematical learning (e.g., employment/application in daily life).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
